intro: Arthrothamnus, commonly known as the spiny tamarisk, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their succulent, often spiny stems and leaves. They are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. Arthrothamnus species are adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems and water-storing tissues. Their small, often pink or red flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, attracting pollinators in dry climates.
